definition: to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: Eg. The innocent are often deceived by the unscrupulous.
sentences.chinese: 天真的人常爲奸詐之徒所欺騙。

sentences.english: She was done in by an unscrupulous broker.
sentences.chinese: 她被一個奸詐的經紀人騙了。

sentences.english: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我離開奸詐的道，開恩將你的律法賜給我。

sentences.english: She lies in wait like a robber and increases the number of the faithless.
sentences.chinese: 她埋伏好像強盜，她使人中多有奸詐的。

sentences.english: Keep me from deceitful ways; be gracious to me through your law.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我離開奸詐的道，開恩將你的律法賜給我。

sentences.english: If I had said, 'I will speak thus, ' I would have betrayed your children.
sentences.chinese: 我若說，我要這樣講，這就是以奸詐待你的衆子。

sentences.english: And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
sentences.chinese: 她奸詐的妹妹猶大也看見了。

sentences.english: Why was backsliding Israel more righteous than treacherous Judah. ?
sentences.chinese: 背道的以色列爲何比奸詐的猶大還顯爲義？

sentences.english: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
sentences.chinese: 我若說，我要這樣講，這就是以奸詐待你的衆子。

sentences.english: Profit made dishonestly always brings trouble. Always.
sentences.chinese: 靠奸詐所獲得的財富總是會帶來麻煩，一直會。

sentences.english: She used devious means to gain power.
sentences.chinese: 她使用狡滑奸詐的手段獲取權力。

sentences.english: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous, and the faithless for the upright.
sentences.chinese: 惡人作了義人的贖價，奸詐人代替正直人。

sentences.english: Don't trust him, he is a sly old fox.
sentences.chinese: 別相信他，他像老狐狸一樣奸詐。

sentences.english: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee;
sentences.chinese: 因爲連你弟兄和你父家都用奸詐待你。

sentences.english: Being single is better than being in an unfaithful relationship.
sentences.chinese: 單是在比被一個奸詐的關係。

sentences.english: His boy was dead, slain by the hand of the false Amulius.
sentences.chinese: 他的兒子被奸詐的阿繆利烏斯殺死了。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to be greedy in getting money
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
